intro: Spartium thebaicum, commonly known as Egyptian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Spartium thebaicum is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
